content.webTitle: Ancelotti urges Jordan Pickford to rely on instincts and cut out mistakes

fields.headline: Ancelotti urges Jordan Pickford to rely on instincts and cut out mistakes
fields.bodyText: Carlo Ancelotti has told Jordan Pickford to rely more on his instincts as most of the Everton goalkeeper’s mistakes stem from over-thinking. The Everton manager has confirmed Pickford will return to the starting line-up against Manchester United on Saturday after being dropped for the first time in his Goodison Park career for last weekend’s defeat at Newcastle. Pickford was replaced at St James’ Park by Robin Olsen, the deadline day loan signing from Roma, following an erratic run of form that raised questions over his composure and preceded the controversy surrounding his challenge on Liverpool defender Virgil van Dijk. Ancelotti, however, insists he has no desire or intention of changing the England international’s mentality, although he believes the 26-year-old’s performances will improve by playing more on instinct. The Everton manager explained: “His mentality is good. I don’t want it to change. He’s a good guy, a funny guy, and I don’t want to change his mentality or his character. I think sometimes he did a mistake because he thought too much. He has to use his instinct more because that is really good. He did fantastic saves because when he reacts he is really top top. When he has to act, sometimes he does mistakes in that situation but he is still a young goalkeeper with a lot of quality and there he can improve. “This is his character and it is difficult to change the character of people. On the pitch he has to be focused on what he is doing, knowing his limit and also knowing where is his quality.” Pickford said it was the first time in seven years that he had been benched when Ancelotti informed the goalkeeper of his decision last week. “I was surprised it was seven years because he is still young,” he admitted. “I talked to him every day this week – we laugh, we were together – and I have no message for him. He knows what to do tomorrow. He starts.” Everton will again be without Richarlison against United as the Brazil international completes a three-match suspension but James Rodríguez, who missed the defeat at Newcastle through injury, is available.
